metadata.title: CVE-2022-3303 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A race condition flaw was found in the Linux kernel sound subsystem due toimproper locking. It could lead to a NULL pointer dereference whilehandling the SNDCTL_DSP_SYNC ioctl. A privileged local user (root or memberof the audio group) could use this flaw to crash the system, resulting in adenial of service condition

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3303` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-239-generic - 4.4.0-239.273
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-239-generic - 4.4.0-239.273
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-239-lowlatency - 4.4.0-239.273
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1155-aws - 4.4.0-1155.170
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1159-aws - 4.15.0-1159.172~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1168-azure - 4.15.0-1168.183~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1088-fips - 4.4.0-1088.95
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1088-fips - 4.4.0-1088.95
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1088-fips - 4.4.0-1088.95
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1088-fips - 4.4.0-1088.95
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1153-gcp - 4.15.0-1153.170~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-214.225~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-214.225~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-214.225~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1118-kvm - 4.4.0-1118.128
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1122-oracle - 4.15.0-1122.133~16.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-239.273').

linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').

linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
